body.p: An act to amend an act entitled "An act to amend article three, Chapter Eighty-six Revised Statutes" approved September 30 1861 --
Sec Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Sec 1 -- That in all cases wherein a judgment or decree has been rendered for the sale of the real estate of an infant or infants upon the petition of the guardian of such infant on infants, and a sale has been made under such judgment ar decree, and it shall appear that there are errors or defects in the proceedings in which the judgment or decree was obtained, it shall be lawful for any purchaser of the estate under such judgment or decree, to file his petition in the Court which rendered such judgment or decree, making all persons interested parties, & upon all such persons having been brought before the Court by actual or constructive service, and the Courts being satisfied that the sale was fairly made, that all the infants have come to full age, that the sale has been confirmed, & the purchase money paid
by the purchaser & been withdrawn by the infant or infants, their guardian or agent, it shall render a decree confirming the original judgment or decree and sale which shall render the same as valid and binding in all respects, as if the original proceedings had been in every respect according to the requirements of the law
Sect II This act shall take effect & be in force from its passage & shall apply to proceedings ^had^ before or after its passage
An Act to Amend an Act entitled "an Act to amend article 3 Chap. 86, Revised Statutes" Approved Sept. 30. 1861
